forkee.name: AFLplusplus
forkee.description: The fuzzer afl++ is afl with community patches, qemu 5.1 upgrade, collision-free coverage, enhanced laf-intel & redqueen, AFLfast++ power schedules, MOpt mutators, unicorn_mode, and a lot more!

issue.title: Delays related to 6b73dee
issue.body:
While reviewing https://github.com/rust-fuzz/afl.rs/pull/392, I noticed some strange behavior regarding 6b73dee.

If you update `afl.rs`'s AFLplusplus submodule to that commit, `cargo build` seems to think the build script always needs to be rerun.

In particular, clone the `afl.rs` repo and then run the following commands:
```sh
git submodule update
cd cargo-afl/AFLplusplus
git checkout 6b73dee
cd .. && cargo run -- afl --version && timeout 5s cargo run -- afl --version
```
The last command will exit with a 124, indicating a timeout.

But if you change the 6b73dee to 6b73dee~1, the last command will complete successfully.

I bisected twice with two different ranges, and both landed on 6b73dee.

Any ideas?

comment.body: Thank you! I can confirm that fixes the problem. Cheers! :tada:

issue.title: Delays related to 6b73dee
issue.body:
While reviewing https://github.com/rust-fuzz/afl.rs/pull/392, I noticed some strange behavior regarding 6b73dee.

If you update `afl.rs`'s AFLplusplus submodule to that commit, `cargo build` seems to think the build script always needs to be rerun.

In particular, clone the `afl.rs` repo and then run the following commands:
```sh
git submodule update
cd cargo-afl/AFLplusplus
git checkout 6b73dee
cd .. && cargo run -- afl --version && timeout 5s cargo run -- afl --version
```
The last command will exit with a 124, indicating a timeout.

But if you change the 6b73dee to 6b73dee~1, the last command will complete successfully.

I bisected twice with two different ranges, and both landed on 6b73dee.

Any ideas?

comment.body:
I should have been more clear.

I saw "Scale encoding" and thought the PR might have something to do with Parity's SCALE encoding. After glancing at the files, I concluded there was no relationship. I mentioned the Parity work just in case you were worried about the possibility of confusion. But the chances of that are probably low.

Sorry for the noise.

commits.message: add scale encode mode for cmplog

Merge pull request #1899 from AFLplusplus/scale

Scale encoding

comment.body:
I have and I only need the compact integer encoding and nothing else. so I rather implement that part myself instead of depending on an external library :)
everything else cmplog can already solve on it's own.

issue.title: Delays related to 6b73dee
issue.body:
While reviewing https://github.com/rust-fuzz/afl.rs/pull/392, I noticed some strange behavior regarding 6b73dee.

If you update `afl.rs`'s AFLplusplus submodule to that commit, `cargo build` seems to think the build script always needs to be rerun.

In particular, clone the `afl.rs` repo and then run the following commands:
```sh
git submodule update
cd cargo-afl/AFLplusplus
git checkout 6b73dee
cd .. && cargo run -- afl --version && timeout 5s cargo run -- afl --version
```
The last command will exit with a 124, indicating a timeout.

But if you change the 6b73dee to 6b73dee~1, the last command will complete successfully.

I bisected twice with two different ranges, and both landed on 6b73dee.

Any ideas?

comment.body:
that was a weird bug hunt. it was because the manpage that is generated for afl-addseeds was not in .gitignore ...
current dev state fixes that.
